speakers.name: Kite Saito
speakers.bio:
Kite Saito is a Certified Dental Technician and Master Dental Ceramist with over 20 years of experience in advanced esthetic and implant restorations. Originally from Yokohama, Japan, Kite trained in Los Angeles, completing the LACC Dental Technology Program in 2004 and finishing the two-year UCLA Master Dental Ceramist Program in 2011.

Today, Kite works at Ozark Prosthodontics in Fayetteville, Arkansas, where he specializes in full-arch monolithic zirconia restorations and the artful use of MiYO® liquid ceramics for lifelike esthetics. He combines cutting-edge digital workflows—including iCam 4D photogrammetry and advanced design strategies—with the artistry of ceramic characterization.

Kite shares his passion and knowledge through hands-on education and international lectures, helping dental professionals achieve predictable, highly esthetic outcomes.

events.title: Mastering Pink Ceramics: Advanced Esthetics in Zirconia
events.description: This two-day intensive hands-on course is designed for dental technicians and clinicians who want to elevate the esthetic quality of their monolithic zirconia restorations using microlayering techniques (MiYO® system). Participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of material selection, color application, and layering techniques to achieve lifelike results with consistency and precision. Through a combination of presentations, live demonstrations, and guided practice, attendees will explore the full workflow of MiYO®—from color and pink layering to structure application, contouring, and final polishing. Each participant will complete and fire their own restorations under expert supervision, ensuring real-world skill development and confidence in achieving natural esthetics.
events.courseDescription:
This two-day intensive hands-on course is designed for dental technicians and clinicians who want to elevate the esthetic quality of their monolithic zirconia restorations using microlayering techniques (MiYO® system). Participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of material selection, color application, and layering techniques to achieve lifelike results with consistency and precision.
Through a combination of presentations, live demonstrations, and guided practice, attendees will explore the full workflow of MiYO®—from color and pink layering to structure application, contouring, and final polishing. Each participant will complete and fire their own restorations under expert supervision, ensuring real-world skill development and confidence in achieving natural esthetics.
objectives: Understand the principles of monolithic restorations and their advantages in strength, efficiency, and esthetics.
Select appropriate zirconia materials and recognize how material choice impacts final shade and translucency.
Understand the rationale of using porcelain microlayering and correctly applying it to reproduce natural enamel and gingival tones.
Layer and manipulate Structure materials to enhance form, depth, and surface vitality.
Execute proper state preparation and understand the importance of surface conditioning prior to ceramic application.
Develop realistic morphology and texture through controlled contouring and surface finishing techniques.
Perform correction and external staining procedures to refine esthetic details and achieve final shade harmony.
Polish and finish restorations to professional standards for long-lasting esthetics and function.
Evaluate and troubleshoot outcomes, ensuring reproducibility in daily laboratory practice.

events.title: Transform Your Practice with Digital Technology
events.description:
Apr 17 - 18, 2026 CE Credits: 12 Register

Share This Course

Transform Your Practice with Digital Technology

Course
Description

This event will start in:

0 Days 0 Hours 0 Minutes 0 Seconds

This lecture and hands-on course is designed to teach the entire dental team how to integrate a digital workflow into a dental office. Restorative dentists and surgeons are encouraged to attend this course with their assistants, hygienists, laboratory technicians, and treatment coordinators. At the conclusion of this two-day course, the entire dental team will have gained an understanding of the major components that make up a successful private practice.
Through a carefully designed curriculum with exciting hands-on workstations, all critical steps for a digital workflow will be explained in detail for each team member. Every participant will receive one-on-one hands-on instructions in a clinical setting utilizing the latest educational mannequins available. In addition, participants will experience intraoral scanning, smile design, face scanning, CBCT acquisition, presurgical and restorative planning, prosthetic designing, 3D printing, and milling of surgical guides, provisionals, and definitive prostheses.
To further the educational experience, this course will focus on five clinical scenarios:

1. Restorative dentistry on natural teeth
2. Single tooth implant restorations
3. Partially edentulous implant restorations
4. Fully edentulous implant restorations
5. Adjunct services (nightguards, whitening, and sleep apnea devices)

In addition, there will be multiple elective presentations available on information technology (IT), return on investment (ROI), 3D printing, smile design, financing options, office design, and surgical planning on both days.

If you are planning on incorporating a digital workflow or simply purchasing any digital technology for your practice, this course will prepare you for the journey

Transform Your Practice with Digital Technology - General Admission

General $1,295.00 32 tickets remaining

Add to Your Calendar

Transform Your Practice with Digital Technology

Speakers

Dr Castro is a double dental training at Pontificia Universidad Javeriana and New York University College of Dentistry, where he also obtained a certificate in Advanced Education in Prosthodontics. He completed his training with a two-year surgical fellowship at Columbia University, mentored by Dr. Dennis Tarnow. During residency, he was the recipient of the Dr. Harold Litvak Fellowship Award and The Kenneth Adisman Award.

Carlos A. Castro DDS, FACP

Board Certified Prosthodontist

Dr. Ana Becil Giglio, board-certified in periodontology and dental implant surgery, has concentrated her career on providing high-quality care to her patients while prioritizing their wellbeing. Dr. Giglio is a member of multiple dental organizations, allowing her to foster and share her clinical knowledge with colleagues. She is a member of the American Academy of Periodontology, the Northeastern Society of Periodontists, the American Dental Association, the Academy of Osseointegration, and a Fellow of the International College of Dentists and the American College of Dentists. Dr. Giglio is also a member of the dental honor society Omicron Kappa Upsilon.

Ana Becil Giglio

Board Certified Prosthodontist

Dr. Graziano D. Giglio is a board-certified prosthodontist focusing on aesthetics and implant dentistry to enhance the quality of life for his patients. Dr. Giglio continually shares and develops his clinical perspective through his affiliation with many prestigious dental organizations. He is a Fellow of the American College of Prosthodontists, the American College of Dentists, the Greater New York Academy of Prosthodontics, and the New York Academy of Dentistry.

Graziano D. Giglio

Board Certified Prosthodontist

Course Objectives

Restorative dentistry on natural teeth Single tooth implant restorations Partially edentulous implant restorations Fully edentulous implant restorations Adjunct services (nightguards, whitening, and sleep apnea devices)

events.title: Immediate Implant Placement: From A to Z Master Hands-On Course
events.description:
Jun 12 - 14, 2026 CE Credits: 12 Register

Share This Course

Immediate Implant Placement: From A to Z Master Hands-On Course

Course
Description

This event will start in:

0 Days 0 Hours 0 Minutes 0 Seconds

Immediate implant placement on fresh sockets and Implant-supported restorations have become increasingly prevalent in implant dentistry. However, there is ongoing debate regarding effective therapies to reduce bone loss around dental implants placed immediately after extraction. Digital dentistry has emerged as a promising approach for improving treatment time efficiency and promoting positive biological outcomes. This course aims to review the current literature on immediate implant placement and discuss the biological principles of an accelerated restorative protocol. It will also explore the impact of digitally designed and fabricated restorations on the development of healthy peri-implant tissues and provide a step-by-step protocol for immediate implant placement and restoration in just two visits. This course will guide you in solving controversial topics like: When to extract or when to save, Graft or not graft.

Immediate Implant Placement

General $2,500.00 10 tickets remaining

Add to Your Calendar

Immediate Implant Placement: From A to Z Master Hands-On Course

Speaker

Dr Castro is a double dental training at Pontificia Universidad Javeriana and New York University College of Dentistry, where he also obtained a certificate in Advanced Education in Prosthodontics. He completed his training with a two-year surgical fellowship at Columbia University, mentored by Dr. Dennis Tarnow. During residency, he was the recipient of the Dr. Harold Litvak Fellowship Award and The Kenneth Adisman Award.

Carlos Castro DDS, FACP

Certified Dental Technician and Master Dental Ceramist

Course
Objectives

To review the biological basis, healing process of dental sockets post-extraction, and implications for resulting bone volume when an implant is placed immediately after extraction. To list the protocol for immediate placement of dental implants in fresh dentoalveolar sockets. To identify the steps and advantages of digital workflows, their potential biologic implications and restorative applications. To review the key factors to control crestal bone loss and how to control them. To demonstrate the protocol of implant placement immediately postextraction. Atraumatic Extractions, Immediate implant placement, Membrane placement, intraoral scanning, Clot protection strategies

Contact
Information

  • 6320 Sugarloaf Parkway Duluth, GA 30097

events.title: Mastering Large Case Acceptance
events.description:
Aug 14, 2026 CE Credits: 10

Clinical and Business Strategies for FFS Practice Growth

Register

Share This Course

Mastering Large Case Acceptance

Course
Description

This event will start in:

0 Days 0 Hours 0 Minutes 0 Seconds

Immediate implant placement on fresh sockets and Implant-supported restorations have become increasingly prevalent in implant dentistry. However, there is ongoing debate regarding effective therapies to reduce bone loss around dental implants placed immediately after extraction. Digital dentistry has emerged as a promising approach for improving treatment time efficiency and promoting positive biological outcomes. This course aims to review the current literature on immediate implant placement and discuss the biological principles of an accelerated restorative protocol. It will also explore the impact of digitally designed and fabricated restorations on the development of healthy peri-implant tissues and provide a step-by-step protocol for immediate implant placement and restoration in just two visits. This course will guide you in solving controversial topics like: When to extract or when to save, Graft or not graft.

Immediate Implant Placement

General $2,500.00 10 tickets remaining

Add to Your Calendar

Mastering Large Case Acceptance

Speakers

Dr. Carlos Castro completed his dental training at both Pontificia Universidad Javeriana and New York University College of Dentistry, where he also obtained a certificate in Advanced Education in Prosthodontics. He completed his training with a two-year surgical fellowship at Columbia University, mentored by Dr. Dennis Tarnow. During residency, he was the recipient of the Dr. Harold Litvak Fellowship Award and The Kenneth Adisman Award. He has served as Clinical Assistant Professor at the Postgraduate Prosthodontics program of Columbia University and New York University. He lectures national and internationally about implant prosthodontics and digital dentistry.

Carlos Castro DDS, FACP

Certified Dental Technician and Master Dental Ceramist

Marina Yefrusi, RDH is a dental hygienist and practice leader at Georgia Prosthodontics with over 15 years of experience in both clinical care and strategic practice management. She has played a pivotal role in the transformation of the practice from an insurance-dependent model to a fully fee-for-service operation, helping to build sustainable systems that prioritize high-value care and exceptional patient experience.

Marina’s expertise lies in treatment coordination, case presentation, and optimizing the patient journey to increase case acceptance—particularly in complex prosthodontic and implant cases. She has also been instrumental in identifying and reaching niche patient markets, including high-net-worth individuals and underserved language-based communities, through tailored messaging and workflow strategies.

Her unique perspective bridges clinical excellence with business growth, making her an invaluable asset in guiding dental teams to thrive in competitive markets without relying on insurance networks.

Marina Yefrusi RDH

Office Manager at Georgia Prosthodontics

Course
Objectives

events.courseDescription:
In this engaging two-hour course, Dr. Carlos Castro, Board-Certified Prosthodontist, and Marina Yefrusi, RDH and Office Manager at Georgia Prosthodontics, share their proven approach to presenting and closing large, complex treatment plans in a fully fee-for-service (FFS) model. Designed for both clinical and administrative team members, this course provides a practical roadmap for increasing case acceptance and achieving sustainable growth—without relying on insurance networks.

Attendees will learn how to deliver compelling consultations, present financial options with confidence, and create a seamless experience that motivates patients to commit to care. In addition, the speakers will reveal the strategies they used to successfully transition out of insurance networks while maintaining— and even increasing—productivity and profitability

events.title: Comprehensive PRF: Protocols, Handling & Clinical Integration
events.description:
May 01 - 02, 2026 CE Credits: 15 Register

Share This Course

Comprehensive PRF: Protocols, Handling & Clinical Integration

Course
Description

This event will start in:

0 Days 0 Hours 0 Minutes 0 Seconds

This immersive two-day course with Dr. Joseph Choukroun demystifies PRF and translates biologic principles into predictable clinical workflows. You’ll review clot biology, growth-factor release kinetics, and how centrifugation settings influence fibrin architecture. Through step-by-step labs, participants prepare A-PRF / S-PRF, fabricate membranes/plugs, and practice combination techniques (e.g., “sticky bone” with particulate grafts)
Clinical modules cover:
● Extraction & ridge preservation with PRF membranes and plugs
● Immediate implant protocols (primary stability, gap management)
● Sinus augmentation (lateral and crestal approaches with PRF adjuncts)
● Soft-tissue management (healing optimization, dehiscence mitigation)
● Documentation/consent & patient communication for biologics

Comprehensive PRF: Protocols, Handling & Clinical Integration

Early Bird $1,499.00 20 tickets remaining

Speaker

Dr. Joseph Choukroun is a physician and researcher based in France, holding his medical degree from the University of Montpellier with specialization in General Surgery, Anesthesiology, and Pain Management. He is the inventor of the PRF (Platelet-Rich Fibrin) family of techniques, including L-PRF, A-PRF, i-PRF, and S-PRF, which have transformed biologic dentistry and regenerative surgery worldwide. 

Dr. Choukroun is the Owner of a private pain-management clinic in Nice, France, and currently serves as President of SYFAC, an internationally recognized symposium focused on growth factors, biomaterials, and tissue regeneration. He has authored numerous scientific papers and has become a leading global voice in the fields of PRF, wound healing, and regenerative medicine. As an international speaker, he has trained thousands of clinicians on biologics, centrifugation protocols, and evidence-based regenerative strategies

Dr. Joseph Choukroun

Physician and Researcher

Course
Objectives

Explain the biologic basis of PRF and how spin protocols affect outcomes Prepare A-PRF / S-PRF, membranes, plugs, and sticky-bone safely and reproducibly Integrate PRF into socket preservation, immediate implants, GBR, and sinus procedures Establish sterilization, tray setup, and documentation/consent workflows for biologics Communicate PRF benefits/limitations to patients and team members

Contact
Information

  • gpsdentaltraining@gaprostho.com
  • 6320 Sugarloaf Parkway Duluth, GA 30097
Download Vcard

Agenda

8:30 AM - 9:00 AM

Registration, breakfast, orientation

9:00 AM - 10:15 AM

PRF biology, fibrin architecture & growth-factor kinetics (A-PRF vs S-PRF indications)

10:30 AM - 12:00 PM

Lab 1: Venipuncture workflow*, tube handling & fabrication of A-PRF membranes and plugs

12:00 PM - 1:00 PM

Lunch & Q&A

1:00 PM - 2:30 PM

Socket and ridge-preservation protocols using A-PRF membranes and plugs

2:45 PM - 4:15 PM

Lab 2: “Sticky-bone” fabrication with S-PRF — timing, viscosity, and consistency control

4:15 PM - 5:30 PM

Case sequences, documentation, consent templates & clinical decision flowcharts

8:30 AM - 9:30 AM

Improving PRF

9:45 AM - 11:15 AM

Lab 3: Sinus-augmentation simulation with A-PRF/S-PRF adjuncts (lateral + crestal concepts)

11:15 AM - 12:00 PM

Complication prevention, biologic stabilization & post-op protocols

12:00 PM - 1:00 PM

Lunch

1:00 PM - 2:30 PM

Soft-tissue optimization using A-PRF/S-PRF; strategies for dehiscence, exposure, and wound healing

2:45 PM - 3:45 PM

Case-planning workshop (participantsu2019 cases welcome)

3:45 PM - 5:00 PM

Implementation playbook: centrifugation settings, tray setup, clinical checklists, and sterilization workflows

Our Sponsors
events.courseDescription:
This immersive two-day course with Dr. Joseph Choukroun demystifies PRF and translates biologic principles into predictable clinical workflows. You’ll review clot biology, growth-factor release kinetics, and how centrifugation settings influence fibrin architecture. Through step-by-step labs, participants prepare A-PRF / S-PRF, fabricate membranes/plugs, and practice combination techniques (e.g., “sticky bone” with particulate grafts)
Clinical modules cover: 
● Extraction & ridge preservation with PRF membranes and plugs 
● Immediate implant protocols (primary stability, gap management) 
● Sinus augmentation (lateral and crestal approaches with PRF adjuncts) 
● Soft-tissue management (healing optimization, dehiscence mitigation) 
● Documentation/consent & patient communication for biologics
objectives: Explain the biologic basis of PRF and how spin protocols affect outcomes
Prepare A-PRF / S-PRF, membranes, plugs, and sticky-bone safely and reproducibly
Integrate PRF into socket preservation, immediate implants, GBR, and sinus procedures
Establish sterilization, tray setup, and documentation/consent workflows for biologics
Communicate PRF benefits/limitations to patients and team members
